page.title: 16Carnival in Glastonbury
page.content: The{carnival}was formed in 1921, and takes place every year in November as part of the Somerset series.The carnival committee are members of the Somerset Guy Fawkes Association,giving their services free of charge. The carnival finds financial support from local business people. Funds raised by the carnival committee are used to support local charities. Young girls sell tickets in a bid to become {Carnival Queen,}the title being held for one year. Carnival floats are of a high standard several months preparation going into each one. Local floats are joined by those of other towns in Somerset, to provide the most colourful evening in the year. Several thousand visitors travel great distances to watch this spectacular procession through the town.
